intro: Banisteria maracaybensis var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed banisteria, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
